channel.title: CVE Feed for AUVESY -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for AUVESY -- all products

item.title: CVE-2021-38449|2024-09-17T02:21:52.699Z -- auvesy -- versiondog
item.description: Some API functions permit by-design writing or copying data into a given buffer. Since the client controls these parameters, an attacker could rewrite the memory in any location of the affected product.

item.title: CVE-2021-38467|2024-09-17T02:31:25.558Z -- auvesy -- versiondog
item.description: A specific function code receives a raw pointer supplied by the user and deallocates this pointer. The user can then control what memory regions will be freed and cause use-after-free condition.

item.title: CVE-2021-38463|2024-09-17T03:38:11.047Z -- auvesy -- versiondog
item.description: The affected product does not properly control the allocation of resources. A user may be able to allocate unlimited memory buffers using API functions.

item.title: CVE-2021-38477|2024-09-17T04:09:59.109Z -- auvesy -- versiondog
item.description: There are multiple API function codes that permit reading and writing data to or from files and directories, which could lead to the manipulation and/or the deletion of files.

item.title: CVE-2021-38451|2024-09-17T01:41:23.696Z -- auvesy -- versiondog
item.description: The affected productâ€™s proprietary protocol CSC allows for calling numerous function codes. In order to call those function codes, the user must supply parameters. There is no sanitation on the value of the offset, which allows the client to specify any offset and read out-of-bounds data.

item.title: CVE-2021-38453|2024-09-17T01:30:40.868Z -- auvesy -- versiondog
item.description: Some API functions allow interaction with the registry, which includes reading values as well as data modification.
